ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Couple of  questions
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Great ... Heh. You ll be lucky if you get a please . I ve found people just say can I have sow . (now that my druid is able to sow). I had one guy come
ygData.messageBody:
> Go to Frontier Mountains, in Kunark, and get into a Giant Fort group.
Great
> exp, nice loot. Druids are always in demand -- "sow please."
>
Heh. You'll be lucky if you get a "please". I've found people just say "can
I have sow". (now that my druid is able to sow). I had one guy come up and
bug me when I was turning in CB belts in Kaladim yesterday. He said "can I
have sow." I said "I can't cast that spell indoors". guy says "What are you
giving him?" me: "Crushbone belts" guy "Can I have sow."
So I tried to cast it on him just to show it wouldn't work. then I told him
the message. I was just about to camp. He's like "ok. tell me when you're
leaving so you can sow me."
I was thinking "would it kill the person to ask if I could go out and sow
him? or to say please?" That has been bothering me lately. Lack of manners.
I've been casting sow on people before they can ask for it lately. they hail
me and I cast it. Just so I won't have to be angry if they don't say please.
Most of them say thanks at least.
anyhoo, I just camped right there and never said another word to the person.
I was too tired to deal with it.
luv,
-Su
